definition: to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
to swallow whole/(fig.) to swallow (lies etc)

sentences.english: Love like sugar, I bolt, enjoy the moment sweet illusion.
sentences.chinese: 爱似糖衣，我囫囵吞下，享受刹那甜蜜的错觉。

sentences.english: He bolted down a bowl of noodles.
You can't swallow the idea in that book overnight.
sentences.chinese: 你不能一个晚上囫囵吞枣式地读完那本书。

sentences.english: Do not read without understanding. One should get what he need.
sentences.chinese: 读书不能囫囵吞枣，而要从中吸取自己需要的东西。

sentences.english: Love like sugar, I bolted to swallow and enjoy the moment sweet illusion.
sentences.chinese: 爱似糖衣，我囫囵吞下，享受刹那甜蜜的错觉。

sentences.english: Do you scoff down a huge lunch before feeling lethargic all afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 囫囵吞枣的吃完午饭，然后又整个下午昏昏沉沉？

sentences.english: That kind of touching can signify that your date is grooving in your general direction.
sentences.chinese: 这种抚摸说明你的同伴是在囫囵的打扮自己。

sentences.english: He ducked with his head and shoulders, scraped with more advanced hoof, bolted the alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 他脑袋和肩膀一缩，前脚一伸，把酒囫囵吞下肚。

sentences.english: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed.
sentences.chinese: 有些书只需浅尝辄止，有些书该囫囵吞食。

sentences.english: Trying to digest new information in one lump is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 想囫囵吞枣消化吸收新信息是困难的。

sentences.english: Some students gobble up information as fast as they receive it.
sentences.chinese: 有些学生一接触信息就囫囵吞枣地马上吸收。

sentences.english: I don't blame him. He probly ain't got a night's sleep since I left.
sentences.chinese: 我不怪他，我走后他连个囫囵觉都甭想睡。

sentences.english: Eat slowly and don't bolt your food.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢吃，别囫囵吞吃食物。

sentences.english: The monkey engulfed the food whole.
sentences.chinese: 这只猴子囫囵吞下食物。

sentences.english: I haven't slept through the night in years.
sentences.chinese: 我已经有好多年从未睡过囫囵觉了。

sentences.english: Wow, you certainy devoured the ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 你简直是把冰淇淋囫囵吞下去。

definition: a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
to spit/to send out (silk from a silkworm, bolls from cotton flowers etc)/to say/to pour out (one's grievances)
to wolf down one's food (idiom); to devour ravenously/to gorge oneself
